chapter.title: Projects
chapter.para: In order to begin utilizing Time and Expense you must create Projects in which to track time and expenses against. xTuple provides the ability to create basic Projects with tasks and review Project progress and budgets. In this chapter the following topics will be covered as they relate to Time and Expense.
Once a Project is created, you can begin entering Time and Expense Sheets!

section.title: Create Project
section.para: The first thing that needs to get done before you can start entering time and expenses is to create a Project to associate these costs with. You can not create these sheets without a Project. To create a Project follow these steps:

listitem.para: Go to this path: CRM > Project > New...
Complete the Project information and refer to Reference Guide for further details regarding specific Project fields.

note.para: If you want the Project to appear on time sheets Project status must be "In-Process"

section.title: Create Project Tasks
section.para: In order to track time and expenses against a Project a task will be required for time sheet entries. When selecting the Project Tasks Tab you will be presented with the following screen.
Click the NEW button to create a new task. Enter task description and details on the following screen.
Under the Billing Tab you can specify a customer, billing rate, and a item that will appear as default values on time sheets.
Click SAVE to close and exit screens.

section.title: Project Reporting
section.para: As Project team members are entering time and expenses against a Project there are a few different areas where the Project Manager can monitor and track this information on the Project itself. First open an existing Project by following these steps.

listitem.para: Go to this path: CRM > Project > List...
Select a Project and click the ACTIVITY button on the Schedule Tab

section.para: This report illustrates current Project activities associated with Sales Orders, Purchase Orders, Work Orders, and Invoices resulting from services billed out via time and expense.

Next select the Summary Tab on the Project. This Summary tab shows a summary of the time and expenses which have been recorded against the Project thus far. Time and Expenses can be entered via a time sheet or a Project Manager can manually enter this data on specific tasks.
Finally if you need a break down of time and expenses by task. Select the Tasks Tab. You will again be presented with the following screen:
Click the PRINT button and you will be able to view a itemized list of tasks that lists the status of each task and the actual hours verses budgeted hours.
